FuncDef:
The domain-location command configures the domain name to be located before or after the delimiter to facilitate system parsing.
The undo domain-location command restores the default domain location.
By default, the domain name is located after the delimiter.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the type of parsing the domain name.
The value is an enumerated type and can be:
after-delimiter:Indicates that the domain name is located after the delimiter.before-delimiter:Indicates that the domain name is located before the delimiter.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
By default, a user uses user name@domain name to log in to a device. To configure a user to use domain name@user name to log in, run the domain-location command to configure the domain name to be located before the delimiter. You can configure a delimiter as required. For details, see domain-name-delimiter.
Precautions
The newly configured domain-location command does not apply to the currently online users in the domain but applies only to the subsequent online users.
